thread.title: Helen Clark resigns from UNDP, according to reports
thread.title_full: Helen Clark resigns from UNDP, according to reports

title: Helen Clark resigns from UNDP, according to reports
text:
Helen Clark resigns from UNDP, according to reports Last updated 13:53, January 26 2017 LAWRENCE SMITH/FAIRFAX NZ 
Former Labour leader and Prime Minister of New Zealand Helen Clark has resigned from her UN post 
Former New Zealand Prime Minister Helen Clark has resigned from her post at the UN, according to reports. 
Clark heads the UN Development Programme, a position she would stand down from in April, AFP reported. 
Citing an email, AFP said Clark notified UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres that she would leave on April 19 at the end of her second four-year term. 
In 2016 Clark was alongside Oprah Winfrey in a list of the world's most powerful women. 
Forbes magazine's 100 "power women" ranked Clark at number 22. 
The 66-year-old, who was prime minister from 1999 until 2008, had hoped to become UN Secretary General, but lost to Guterres last year.
